title: I just received in the mail a request for entry of default. What does this mean??
question: Back in June 2014, I received a summons from a creditor (Portfolio Recovery Associates). Instead of answering the summons, the creditor and I came up with a payment plan to pay off the debt and told me as long as I was making my payments, the lawsuit will not go through as we now settled this. I have been faithful in paying the payments and thought everything was ok and still doing so. All of a sudden, I get this. What does it mean? I don't understand this at all. Reason why I didn't answer the summons and instead settled with the creditor was because I could not afford a lawyer, not even just to help me fill out the answer form. I've barley been making ends meet since this arrangement was made and have a second one with them as well and I just don't understand what this request means.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Summons and complaint,Sued for debt,Default judgment
answers: It means they are seeking to proceed to judgment on the grounds that you have failed to file a timely response to the summons and complaint. If you are too poor to pay an attorney try one of the legal aid clinics. Do not ignore this (also check into whether this violates the federal fair debt collections practices act or its California equivalent). Good luck.

Did the settlement agreement get signed by all the parties? You should call the attorneys for the other side and request that a default not be entered. After you pay all the payments, then make sure you get a satisfaction of judgement

Mr Chen is correct. Since you did not answer the summons and complaint, the Creditors Attorney can request the entry of a default. The entry of a default will prevent you from participating in the law suit and raising any defenses you may have. Perhaps you can seek help from a local legal aid office. Under the circumstances they may be able to reverse any default in that you were responding directly to the creditors attorney.

A request for entry of default is a document which a plaintiff submits to the court to inform the court that a defendant who was properly served with the summons and complaint failed to timely respond to the summons and complaint. A request for entry of default is a prerequiste to a request for a court judgment by default or a request for a clerk judgment by default.

The request for entry of default was probably filed in error. If the default is entered, the plaintiff's attorney ought to stipulate to set aside the default. If the plaintiff's attorney refuses to stipulation, then you will need to file the motion to set aside default.

Once you make all of the payments pursuant to your arrangement, the plaintiff ought to file a request for dismissal.
